title: Warned about presence of old GPU which is disabled
body_html:
I have a Quadro K620 and K80. Even though I hide the Quadro by excluding it from NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES, I get a UserWarning when executing Pytorch:

/opt/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/init.py:97: UserWarning:
Found GPU1 Quadro K620 which is of cuda capability 5.0.
PyTorch no longer supports this GPU because it is too old.

This is reproducible using the main-gpu.py code in this Pytorch tutorial directory:
https://github.com/yunjey/pytorch-tutorial/blob/master/tutorials/02-intermediate/recurrent_neural_network/main-gpu.py

nvidia-smi -a log:
https://pastebin.com/raw/Kei6NwA9

NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=1,2

  • OS: Arch Linux, kernel 4.15.2
  • PyTorch version: 0.3.1
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
  • Python version: 3.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1 / 7.0
  • GPU models and configuration: Quadro K620, Tesla K80

body:
I have a Quadro K620 and K80. Even though I hide the Quadro by excluding it from NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES, I get a UserWarning when executing Pytorch:

/opt/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py:97: UserWarning: 
    Found GPU1 Quadro K620 which is of cuda capability 5.0.
    PyTorch no longer supports this GPU because it is too old.

This is reproducible using the main-gpu.py code in this Pytorch tutorial directory:
https://github.com/yunjey/pytorch-tutorial/blob/master/tutorials/02-intermediate/recurrent_neural_network/main-gpu.py

nvidia-smi -a log:
https://pastebin.com/raw/Kei6NwA9

NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=1,2 

- OS: Arch Linux, kernel 4.15.2
- PyTorch version: 0.3.1
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
- Python version: 3.6
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1 / 7.0
- GPU models and configuration: Quadro K620, Tesla K80
